channel.title: Interfaces on David Raab
channel.description: Recent content in Interfaces on David Raab

item.title: interfaces in functional programming
item.description: Recently I worked with Raylib a graphics library for doing/learning game development. When I created multiple small demos there was one thing I wanted todo across multiple projects. I wanted to drag game objects on the screen. I already solved that problem once so now I just needed to create a general function that allowed me to drag any kind of object, instead of writing a specific solution again and again.

item.title: Functions are interfaces
item.description: When I started to learn C# around 2013 there were certainly new things I came into contact. Some of them had todo with the fact that I primarily used Perl, a dynamic typed language, but in some sense the language features of Perl were also far ahead of C# back then, leading to different solutions and how you use a language. Back at that time I realised that a lot of programmers were into a “newly” thing.
